title: Supply Chain Engineer
description:
**Job location:** Remote with 50% travel (25% of your travel will be to Alexandria, LA and 25% of your travel will be international to meet with suppliers)

**Compensation:** $90,000 to $120,000

**Benefits:** Medical, Dental, Vision, parental leave, 401(k) match up to 4% + annual discretionary 401k employer contribution, company paid short & long-term disability, 2-3 weeks PTO + personal/sick time + 11 total holidays.

**Education / Certifications:** Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Industrial or Mechanical), Logistics, or related field, from an accredited college or university.

**Required Experience:** 

* 5 or more years’ experience in manufacturing environment working with supply chain & logistics.
* (FRA (Federal Railroad Administration) and AAR (American Association of Railroads) experience preferred, not required.
* Previous experience in a national heavy industrial manufacturing business.
* Experience with factory support and improving sustaining operations.

**Preferred:** 

* Experience leading continuous improvement, Lean Six Sigma certification preferred, not required.
* CPSM, ISM or other certifications preferred.
* Experience building relationships and developing international suppliers with an emphasis on raw material, components, and services.

**SUMMARY OF POSITION:**

This position is accountable for developing new suppliers to assist in meeting material cost savings goals. They will identify and work with potential suppliers and third-party engineering firms to design and test products. The supply chain engineer is responsible for formulating component manufacturing specifications and performing design analysis to ensure all products meet industry standards and guidelines. The Supply Chain Engineer should provide data analysis by collecting, inspecting, cleaning, sorting, and processing data into relevant information to aid decision making, and interpret market research to determine profitable product ideas, therefore data analysis skills are integral to the role. To ensure success, the supply chain engineer should exhibit extensive knowledge of business operations and experience in heavy industrial manufacturing.

**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND/OR ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:**

* Look for cost effective ways to develop new suppliers and products by evaluating costs and seeking more economical alternatives and develop solutions to production issues to optimize the process and ensure cost-effectiveness.
* Document all activity during the development stage of components; perform tests for performance analysis and document results. Lead product changes and improvements as needed.
* Build and maintain strong, collaborative relationships and keep abreast of developments in supply chain engineering.
* Collaborate with finance, procurement, and manufacturing teams to determine the best potential vendors and distributors.
* Maintain strong project management skills to manage a project from start to finish within certain constraints. It includes budgeting, scheduling, setting goals, creating timelines, and accountability. The product development cycle involves various phases that are the responsibility of the Supply chain Engineer.
* Establish quality control measure with the QA team to ensure compliance with industry standards and maintain compliance with these measure with all design team members. Where necessary, create guidelines to guarantee the protection and safety of colleagues

**SKILLS/SPECIFICATIONS:**

* Excellent communication skills which include presentations, technical writing, and listening skills.
* Ability to investigate, derive conclusions from observations/data and analytically approach corrective actions.
* Confidence, patience, tact, and diplomacy, when dealing with difficult situations and various personalities.
* Ability to work on multiple projects, prioritize work and manage time effectively.
* Always convey a high level of professionalism.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
* Knowledge of Micro Station and Solid Edge software is a plus.

**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Industrial or Mechanical), Logistics, or related field, from an accredited college or university.
* 5 or more years’ experience in manufacturing supply chain & logistics.
* Experience leading continuous improvement, Lean Six Sigma certification strongly preferred.
* Regulated industry experience required (FRA and AAR experience strongly preferred)
* CPSM, ISM or other certifications preferred.
* Previous experience in a national heavy industrial manufacturing business preferred.
* Experience building relationships and developing international suppliers with an emphasis on raw material, components, and services.
* Experience with factory support and improving sustaining operations.
* Strong analytical skills, emotional intelligence, organizational skills, and presentation skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Manufacturing facility
* Remote

Work Location: Remote

title: Principal Validation Engineer
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.


Principal Validation Engineer

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this role you will lead and coordinate Packaging Process Validation, Packaging Equipment C&Q/Characterization, Packaging Components Qualifications, Commercial Support, Process Monitoring, Deviations/CAPA’s and Lab Operation for Combination Products.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Ensure initiation/preparation and closeout of all validation related documents and change controls
* Overseen development of Validation Plan and Strategy
* Manage C&Q/Characterization and Validation execution
* Align Strategy and responses for internal audits on Packaging Equipment’s validation Protocol and Plans
* Act as a Validation Lead for all validation projects
* Coordinate business activities and assign business tasks to support executions
* Evaluate proposed changes to validated systems and recommend level of validation required
* Led all aspects of project management activities for validation projects process within the scope of an overall system project
* Assist with the development of system requirements and specifications to ensure requirements are testable and met
* Implement or coordinate the execution of validation plans and validation documents;
* Coach the implementation teams in the proper execution of validation documents;
* Preapprove test scripts before they are executed and approve after they have been executed.

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The engineering professional we seek will possess these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------


Doctorate Engineer or Science degree & 2 years of directly related experience


OR


Master’s Engineer or Science degree & 4 years of directly related experience


OR


Bachelor’s Engineer or Science degree & 6 years of directly related experience


Or


Associate’s degree and 10 years of directly related experience


Or


High school diploma / GED and 12 years of directly related experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* 6 + years biotech or pharmaceutical industry experience
* Validation experience on Pharmaceutical Packaging Process and Equipment Validation with focus on Combination Products
* Able to facilitate and influence senior collaborators and partners
* Able to successfully manage workload and timelines
* Ability to negotiate a strategic position after taking feedback from multiple sources
* Strong project management, problem-solving, and analytical skills
* Collaborates and communicates well with others, able to balance divergent inputs from various partners and drive issue resolution
* Ability to operate in a matrixed environment with site, functional, and executive leadership
* Experience driving decision making by using DAI principles

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now**
-------------

**for a career that defies imagination**


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

**careers.amgen.com**
---------------------


Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Management Engineer
description:
##### **Introduction**


Do you have the career opportunities as a Management Engineer you want with your current employer? We have an exciting opportunity for you to join Parallon which is part of the nation's leading provider of healthcare services, HCA Healthcare.

##### **Benefits**


Parallon, offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include:

* Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation.
* Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more.
* Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing
* 401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service)
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock
* Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance.
* Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more
* Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts
* Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships
* Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships)
* Colleague recognition program
* Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)
* Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income.


Learn more about Employee Benefits

***Note: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.***  



Our teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. Do you want to work as a Management Engineer where your passion for creating positive patient interactions are valued? If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise!

##### **Job Summary and Qualifications**


Under general supervision of department Leadership, the Management Engineer plays a lead role in process improvement projects by performing operational assessments, including labor, productivity, scheduling and process analyses and presenting results and recommendations. The role will also assist in developing measurement tools to monitor and drive improvement across Parallon service lines. Qualified candidates should be able to demonstrate a proven record of accomplishment and the ability to communicate and work collaboratively across teams.

**What you will do in this role:**

* Facilitates process and operational quality improvement projects by functioning as an analyst, consultant, and/or project manager as required. Plans, coordinates and conducts studies to produce operational best-demonstrated practices; analyzes and evaluates departmental organization, processes, methods, and equipment; recommends changes or improvements based on study results. Sets specific productivity goals and directs the activities strategically and operationally to meet those goals. Develops methods for measuring outcomes against standards; assists in the identification of criterions and effective qualitative/quantitative measurement tools.
* Consults with leaders in operational areas under evaluation for best-demonstrated practices and facilitates implementation efforts enterprise-wide. Identifies problems and issues, communicates them to the appropriate individuals, and recommends solutions.
* Performs analysis and benchmarking on current productivity standards. Recommends changes, as appropriate, to productivity standards and implements new standards.
* Supports enterprise-wide process improvement initiatives by facilitating and/or leading benchmarking exercises, internally and externally to drive further transformational productivity.
* Develops data models to understand the changes in volume/staffing levels and the business impact of such changes. Using the model, forecast volume and required staffing levels.
* Provides ongoing support to leadership in the use of the productivity and forecasting tools. Lead the implementation of the productivity tool across all departments.
* Monitors appropriate indicators for maximum productivity, efficiency, and resource utilization.
* Coordinates and conducts training for staff on new processes and systems.
* Makes presentations to a wide audience at the company and unit levels. Must have extensive PC skills including spreadsheets, databases, presentation and other productivity applications.
* Must have strong written and presentation skills, as well as experience in process re-engineering and the application of quantitative analysis techniques as applied in a shared service setting.
* Ability to evaluate vendor proposals and implement as necessary to meet strategic goals.
* Must demonstrate the ability to move beyond labor and productivity management by providing input toward areas such as resource consumption, supply management, business consolidations and information systems utilization. Will work closely with Operations Support and Analytics teams to capitalize on synergies within the business unit.

###### **What qualifications you will need:**

* Bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering, management engineering or related technical area
* Other business-related degrees will be considered if prior experience supports knowledge required for the role
* Master’s preferred
* Three or more years of related experience required
* Experience in staffing, FTE management, productivity management, process improvement preferred
* Experience with shared service operations, call center management, healthcare and/or financial services preferred
* Experience with remote workforces a plus

**Parallon** provides full-service revenue cycle management, or total patient account resolution, for HCA Healthcare. Our services include scheduling, registration, insurance verification, hospital billing, revenue integrity, collections, payment compliance, credentialing, health information management, customer service, payroll and physician billing. We also provide full-service revenue cycle management as well as targeted solutions, such as Medicaid Eligibility, for external clients across the country. Parallon has over 17,000 colleagues, and serves close to 1,000 hospitals and 3,000 physician practices, all making an impact on patients, providers and their communities.


HCA Healthcare has been recognized as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies® by the Ethisphere Institute more than ten times. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.7 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

  

  

"Bricks and mortar do not make a hospital. People do."- Dr. Thomas Frist, Sr.  

HCA Healthcare Co-Founder


If you are looking for an opportunity that provides satisfaction and personal growth, we encourage you to apply for our Management Engineer opening. We promptly review all applications. Highly qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews. **Unlock the possibilities and apply today!**

*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: MOCVD Epitaxy Process Engineer
description:
MOCVD Epitaxy Process Engineer



Remote, United States



JOB DESCRIPTION



We are seeking a remote MOCVD Epitaxy Process Engineer to drive growth of GaAs and InP materials. The engineer is responsible for the operation and maintenance of one or more MOCVD machines growing epitaxial layers for compound semiconductor edge emitting lasers and VCSELs. This role will closely work with our international team to develop epitaxy technology, work on a variety of products and processes and contribute to significant, visible impact on the organization’s overall success.



This position is fully remote.

 **Primary Duties & Responsibilities**


* Lead and Supervise MOCVD machines and processes, onsite at Fremont and remote operation
* Own the process of developing, planning, executing, and reporting manufacturing processes
* Ensure automated data collection and control of instruments. Report data and analysis
* Implement SPC control and follow TPM protocol
* Publish results to the business unit

  


**Education & Experience**


PhD or MS in Materials Science, Physics, or Electrical Engineering and 10-year hands-on MOCVD epitaxial experience is required  

* 

  

**Skills**


* Continuous improvement
* Knowledge of MOCVD and Laser Device
* Ability to drive a team and work across international groups
* Strong interpersonal skills
* General understanding of epitaxy, III-V material systems and chemistry
* Experience with automated data collection
* Excellent communication skills – ability to communicate work plans, schedules, resource needs

  


*VitalchemUSA is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment irrespective of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  



ABOUT US



Vital is a global leader in Compound Semiconductor and Infrared Materials. The company is vertically integrated in many areas of its business serving compound semiconductors, clean energy, night vision, health and many other areas.

title: Global Process Engineer – Global Shared Services
description:
**Posted Date:** Feb 26, 2024  

**Employment Type:** Full Time

**Pay Range:**


(Minimum to mid pay range specific to NY, CA, CO, WA)


95,400.00 - 119,200.00 USD Annual
Brinks Texas License #C00550


#LI-Remote


The Brink’s name is a promise to respect the trust we’ve earned in over 150 years in business. Every employee honors that promise by offering the highest levels of service and support to our customers. We take pride in our work, and we share a passion about our future. Learn why so many people have made the choice to join our team – and stay here.

**Job Title**


Global Process Engineer – Global Shared Services**Job Description**


The Brink’s Company (NYSE:BCO) is a leading global provider of cash and valuables management, digital retail solutions, and ATM managed services. Our customers include financial institutions, retailers, government agencies, mints, jewelers and other commercial operations. Our network of operations in 52 countries serves customers in more than 100 countries.


At Brink’s we believe that diverse teams drive success, and as such we foster an inclusive culture that values people with diverse backgrounds, ideas and perspectives. We build a sense of belonging so all employees feel respected, safe and valued, and we provide equal opportunity to participate and grow.


We are currently looking for a Global Process Engineer – Global Shared Services


The Global Process Engineer, reporting to the Director of Global Process for Global Shared Services, will be responsible for designing and implementing efficient business processes to support the overall operation of the company and drive multiple projects across global shared services. This role will involve analyzing current processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing new systems and procedures to streamline operations and increase productivity.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Support the Director of Global Process and center process managers to drive various projects that are identified and prioritized to improve service, increase capacity/productivity, reduce error rates, drive incremental savings, and improve controls
* Support root cause analysis for process performance issues and develop remediation plans through process mapping and gap identification
* Support Global process leads drive unified standards, policy compliance, and uncover variability across the global Brinks organization
* Support the implementation of new processes or software/technologies
* Design and implement new systems and procedures to streamline operations
* Support ERP and other strategic or global systems initiatives across the company
* Collaborate with other departments to ensure smooth integration of new processes, leading change management activities, including communication and training activities
* Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of new processes
* Continuously improve existing processes to increase efficiency and productivity
* Develop process maps and swim lane documentation as needed
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams in the implementation of process improvements
* Monitor and report on the performance of process improvements, including metrics such as cost savings, efficiency gains, improved controls, and customer satisfaction
* Promote best practices across the organization
* Support acquisition integration to help migrate and shift processes to Global Shared Services

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE**

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Accounting / Finance / Business Administration / Engineering or equivalent required
* Two to five years of experience in hands-on Finance and Accounting or in a Global Shared Service center
* Significant experience and use of relevant systems and technology
* Strong project management experience
* Experience with process mapping and process redesign tools
* Strong analytical skills, collecting and analyzing data, evaluating information and systems, and drawing logical conclusions
* Strong consultative and problem-solving skills
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Office, especially in Excel and PowerPoint.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills with track record of superior customer service
* Excellent verbal and written communications, including active listening skills, verbal presentation skills and skills in presenting findings and recommendations
* Familiarity with process improvement methodologies such as Six Sigma and Lean is a plus.

**Ability to:**

* Drive change across various stakeholder groups
* Stay organized and communicate progress on projects
* Develop and communicate performance for respective process area
* Analyze, problem solve, and drive decision-making
* Build effective internal customer relationships
* Communicate effectively with all levels of management
* Deliver measurable impact through process standardization and optimization
* Design and develop process maps and procedures
* Work under pressure and manage multiple projects at once across various functions
* Support audit and SOX compliance activities (as needed)
* Maintain positive relationships with end users and other internal constituents

Brink’s is the global leader in security and logistics services, trusted by banks, financial institutions and businesses in both public and private sectors. We deliver the currency of the world to businesses in our communities. We do it because we’re needed. We do it because we’re trusted and valued. We do it because it makes us proud. Brink’s Proud.

--------------------

Brink’s is also committed to providing a drug free workplace.*

title: Senior Process Control Engineer
description:
**The Role** ***What's the job?***



This Senior Process Control Engineer for Siding Products Group is responsible for the leadership and direction of quality systems and process control strategy related to the production process multiple SPG plants. The incumbent will lead efforts to analyze and reduce process variation, develop preventive controls, and ensure quality standards are upheld.



Additionally, the incumbent will collaborate with Manufacturing, R&D, Central Engineering, Product Management, Warranty Claims team and other critical functional areas to deliver on key organizational objectives with a specific focus on Quality & Process Control systems and ensure optimal and consistent resource management; partnering with plant leadership to achieve all plant targets.



Essential Functions:


**Quality and Process Control - 80% of time**


* Conduct Quality & Process audits across several US & Canada plants
* Conduct analysis on process capability and support with implementation of process capability improvement
* Lead Quality & Process improvement projects across several plants
* Designs and manages the process for external supplier quality validation process, responsible for oversight of 3rd party quality compliance.
* Provides Quality systems training for plant personnel and external suppliers.
* Investigates customer claims and sales complaints to identify root cause, makes recommendations for corrective action and resolves with appropriate parties
* Represents plant at job site inspections and develops strong working relationship with claims inspectors and processing team as needed.
* Utilizes statistical process control (SPC) techniques and complex data analysis to identify and analyze quality trends and facilitates discussions to develop corrective/preventive actions.
* Works directly with plant peers, engineers on projects – designing quality into product, process, and formulation changes, validating compliance with regulatory bodies and product specifications, customer satisfaction and continuous improvement opportunities.
* Implement & standardize in-process checks, in-line measurements and inspections
* Develop data collection plan from incoming inspection, in-process, and finished good inspection
* Analyze manufacturing data across several plants, and work with Q&PC team to conduct process capability studies to improve yield and other COPQ metrics such as customer claims, scrap, and internal rejects.
* Collaborate with IT and other functions to Lead data monitoring implementation across plants


**Leadership, team and self-development - 20% of time**


* Facilitates and leads cross functional teams with a focus on customer expectations and quality. (Six Sigma, SPC, WCM, internal audit teams, training teams).
* Takes responsibility for own development as a Quality Management professional, seeking out certifications and education to lead a culture that embraces the concept of manufacturing quality into products from product development through processing, validating through process analysis and product inspections.
* Approachable and coaches for improved performance; can coach upward, downward and across functions to help individuals and the plant achieve goals
* Supports the training team with advanced quality expertise and develops user friendly and audience specific training materials.
* Work collaboratively with Plant personnel, Plant Mgrs, Engineers, Directors and other peers. Interpersonal skills to influence without authority, ability to present cases factually and in true team spirit. Must be an ambassador of our Trust, Empowerment and Collaboration ways of working

  

**Requirements** ***What do you bring?***


* A bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or a related technical field ***required***
* Six Sigma training preferred
* **A minimum of 50% travel is required for this role**
* Ten (10) years of experience with Quality and ISO is required
* Ten (10) years of Quality & Process/Manufacturing Engineering work experience, demonstrating increasing levels of responsibility
* Design of Experiments is preferred
* Five (5) years of project management experience is preferred
* Five (5) years of experience with Statistical Process Controls is required
* Experience with Data analysis skills – including MS Excel, MS Access and Minitab is required

  

**Additional Requirements**  

* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Good coach – able to bring out the best in others
* Good conflict resolution skills, ability to diffuse volatile situations
* Strong presentation skills
* Team player - good facilitation and influencing skills
* Ability to represent the plant and company for external audits and inspections

  

**About Us**  

Through the responsible development of innovative and sustainable building products, **CertainTeed**, headquartered in Malvern, Pennsylvania, has helped shape the building products industry for more than 110 years. Founded in 1904 as General Roofing Manufacturing Company, the firm's slogan "Quality Made Certain, Satisfaction Guaranteed," inspired the name CertainTeed. Today, CertainTeed is a leading North American brand of exterior and interior building products, including roofing, siding, fence, decking, railing, trim, insulation, drywall, and ceilings.



A subsidiary of Saint-Gobain, one of the world’s largest and oldest building products companies, CertainTeed has more than 6,300 employees and more than 60 manufacturing facilities throughout the United States and Canada. www.certainteed.com  



  

**Legal Statement**  

Saint-Gobain provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Saint-Gobain is an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and supports the hiring of veterans.

 **Benefits** ***Our Perks***



We provide unique options to fit your unique lives! Our Total Rewards Program is customizable to accommodate your needs. Our menu of flexible options includes, but is not limited to:


* Excellent healthcare options: Medical, vision, prescription & dental
* Family Focus & Balance: Parental leave, paid time-off and Employee Assistance Program
* Financial Security: Competitive 401(k), Company-funded Retirement Accumulation Plan and Employee Stock Purchase Program (PEG)
* Tuition Reimbursement: Continuing education for every season of your career
* Pet Insurance options: Insurance plan & prescription discount program for your furry friends
* Employee Recognition Programs
* PerkSpot: Our exclusive one-stop online discount marketplace
* LiveWell: Rewarding you for living a healthy lifestyle

title: Oracle Consultant Digitized Processes
description:
**The focus:** Digitized processes and Oracle enterprise applications
  
  

**The goal is clear:** Excellent business processes with Oracle®
  
digitization solutions! And your job is to show our demanding customers
  
the way to the digital future. Together with the customer, you will
  
design intelligent business processes in which modern, market-leading
  
digitization technologies can fully develop their potential. Based on
  
agile and hybrid process models, you will configure enterprise software
  
systems that are precisely tailored to the customer’s business
  
processes. You are responsible for turnkey implementation and
  
accompanying change management.
  
  

PROMATIS Corp. thrives on our fast-pace, start-up culture that gives
  
our employees the opportunity and freedom to operate in many different
  
aspects of the business. Backed by a Global Group with 30+ of
  
experience, you can make an immediate impact to the success and growth
  
of our business.
  
  

Tasks
  
  

**A variety of tasks await you:**  

* Analysis and improvement of business processes. A special feature:


In workshops, for process visualization and documentation you will use
  
Horus® business process tools and ready-made best practice reference
  
models.
  
* Together with the customer’s subject matter experts, you will


develop requirement specifications for the configuration of the target
  
system and specifications for customer-specific additional developments
  
and integrations following a standardized procedure. In addition, you
  
will define suitable test cases.
  
* Design, configuration, personalization and testing of business processes in the enterprise software system:
* Oracle E-Business Suite
* Oracle Cloud Applications
* Oracle NetSuite ERP
* heterogeneous systems
* Conceptual design of the data migration as well as support in the


transformation process, data cleansing and migration execution.
  
  

* Support of the organizational change management. In addition, planning and implementation of training and coaching measures.
* As required, support of the customer in the operating phase, solving


of application problems and elimination of system errors, as well as
  
ongoing maintenance and further development of the system.
  
  

Requirements
  
  

**You bring to the table:**  

* Degree in industrial engineering, information systems, information


management, business administration with IT affinity, computer science
  
with business affinity or career changer with practical business
  
experience
  
  

* Sound business knowledge and ideally user experience in at least one of the following areas:
* Finance and Accounting
* Enterprise Performance Management
* SCM/Logistics and Production
* Customer Experience (sales, marketing, service)
* Personnel management (HCM)
* Responsible use of digital technologies and AI with the goal of creating sustainable human user experiences
* Excellent communication skills, abstraction and structuring skills,


diligence in creating documentation and presentation materials, and good
  
German and English language skills
  
  

* Mobility in project work at home and abroad


Benefits
  
  

**What we offer:**  

* Health Insurance - United Healthcare Platinum Plan (100% of premium is paid by company)
* Vision Insurance- VSP Plan (included in United Healthcare Plan)
* Dental Insurance - Delta Dental
* Life Insurance (Principal Life Insurance) - One year's salary
* Short Term, Long Term Disability, AD&D
* 401(k) plan – Employer match of up to 4% of employee contribution, 100% vested immediately (AMG National Trust)
* 18 PTO Days in first year of employment / 23 PTO starting the second


year of employment (carry over up to 40 hours into next calendar year)
  
* 10 sick leave days
* 12 paid holidays
* 2 floating holidays (do not carry over)
* International travel opportunities (primarily the DACH region)
* Mobile Device (T-Mobile service plan) pending business need


Salary range depends on level of experience and areas of expertise. A typical
  
consultant at PROMATIS Corp. can expect to earn between $70,000 and
  
$125,00 per year.
  
  

If you are interested in challenging and varied tasks at our company, we look forward to receiving your application via email.
  
  

PROMATIS Corp. is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.

title: Packaging Engineer
description:
Job Title: Packaging Engineer


Location: Remote, Chicago, IL/Midwest or Central, PA preferred


Travel: Up to 75%

  


**Summary:**


With minimal supervision from the Manager, the position leads the design and technical development of packaging solutions for new and existing products. This position is responsible for the development of packaging materials by working with Project Teams and Vendors to recommend, review, test and identify costs for various packaging design proposals. The position is responsible for creating detailed specifications and accurate bill of materials for successful packaging implementation. The position supports production facilities by assisting in issues resolution and optimizing packaging design to ensure peak performance.


The position is expected to manage a mix of low-to-medium complexity commercial projects which require fundamental packaging technology expertise. As a representative on project teams, the position is expected to advocate the best interests of packaging via sharing of technical knowledge, gathering fact-based data, providing analytics, and implementing solutions which deliver against project scope and expectations.

  


**Major Duties & Key Responsibilities:**


**Product & Packaging Development/Commercialization**


* Collaborate with project initiator to define, understand, and align to project objectives and expectations.
* Design, review, recommend, and test various packaging design proposals.
* Consider various packaging material substrates and structures in the design of primary, secondary and tertiary packaging to minimize material usage and optimize manufacturing and labor efficiencies, while maintaining product integrity and enhancing retail performance and aesthetics.
* Determine impact of new packaging design on existing and new automation systems at manufacturing locations.
* Develop design-of-experiments/test methodologies on packaging materials and structures to determine performance attributes best suited to maintain product quality, integrity, and maximize shelf-life while minimizing costs.
* Conduct analytical testing on materials and structures; evaluate and interpret technical data findings and clearly communicate results to stakeholders.
* Coordinate and support equipment trials, line trials, distribution tests, etc. to validate new packaging materials and structural designs
* Recommend best design, align with stakeholders, and execute optimized packaging design solution.
* Contribute to project success through clear written and verbal correspondence and presentations understandable by stakeholders of varying technical & business understanding
* Ensure projects remain on schedule by setting achievable expectations, proactively driving tasks for on-time completion, proactively highlighting potential risks to task completion, timely responses to communications, and actively participating in project team meetings.
* Simultaneously manage multiple projects and prioritize work accordingly to meet established and aligned to timelines and deliverables for each.
* Assess and resolve identified packaging design problems and opportunities (ie. consumer, retail, distribution, manufacturing performance) on existing items. Work with cross-functional stakeholders to implement design, quality, process, and system improvements as a result of findings to ensure long-term corrective action.

  




**Documentation**


* Create and publish robust and accurate specifications which detail critical attributes to ensure consistent material quality and packaging assembly to meet aligned performance requirements. This includes mechanical drawings, written specifications, and process instructions.
* Provide necessary packaging component mechanical drawings for artwork development and layout. Approve graphical artwork for correct application to mechanical drawing and critical-to-function attributes (ie. UPC, date code, eyetrack)
* Create, enter and publish accurate packaging bill of materials into the Material Data Management System to enable planning and sourcing of materials, and correct build of the Finished Good Item.
* Publish specifications and bill of materials to meet established timelines and priorities to enable production planning and material order requirements.
* Support creation and review of packaging quality standards and tolerances, and regulator documents.
* Work with Procurement to obtain cost estimates for new packaging materials by providing necessary specifications and information. Assist in presenting cost estimates for input into business case impact analytics.
* Ensure packaging related risks and key decisions are proactively, timely, visibly, clearly, and thoroughly documented in project team minutes, gate review documentation, on-line project folder/archives, project presentations, and emails.
* Ensure technical reports documenting test results, data, and analytics are appropriately archived in shared data sites/folders, project folder/archives, etc. for easy identification and retrieval.

  




**Packaging Optimization**


* Identify and initiate packaging research aimed at decreasing costs, reducing material usage, and improving recyclability while maintaining product & packaging integrity.
* Partner with Procurement on implementation of cost reduction strategies/initiatives.
* Conduct value analysis activities to identify and implement packaging material and structural changes to improve production and labor efficiencies.
* Review internal and external customer data to understand causation of packaging failure or sub-optimal performance, and develop/implement corrective actions accordingly.
* Identify and drive opportunities to standardize materials to reduce complexity and enable volume leveraged pricing for packaging components

  




**Continuous Self-Development and Improvement**


* Develop and maintain a professional knowledge of new and emerging trends in packaging technology.
* Identify areas of opportunity to implement new technologies into packaging solutions.
* Identify individual Global Behavior and ‘Ways of Working’ gaps, develop action plan to close gaps, and actively work to close gaps and strengthen skillsets/behaviors

  


**Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:**


* Possess basic understanding of packaging concepts and principles.
* Fundamental technical knowledge of packaging materials and converting technologies
* Possess mechanical aptitude and ability to understand interrelation of material & equipment
* Ability to design transport simulation tests and interpret results.
* Good critical thinking skills to consider how constraints/changes impact design and functional attributes
* Demonstrated successful problem solving process skills
* Ability to make rational decisions independently and seek assistance as needed for complex matters
* Ability to successfully communicate complex subject matter both verbally and in written form to audiences of varying organizational levels and technical/business understanding with some manager guidance.
* Basic understanding of supply chain operations and cross-functional partner responsibilities
* Able to work collaboratively with others to accomplish a common objective.
* Self-motivated and takes initiative/action with minimal direction
* Ability to successfully and consistently prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Good organizational, time management, and communication skills to meet commitments.
* Strong PC skills; Outlook, Excel, Powerpoint, Cape/Tops, MS Teams, SAP(nice to have)

  




**Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:**


BS in Packaging Engineering preferred with 1-3 years of Packaging Development experience.


BS in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering or related science field with 1-3 years of experience in Packaging Development.



The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Lead Validation Engineer
description:
Valspec—a global provider of system validation and lifecycle services—provides commissioning and qualification of computerized systems for clients in the Life Sciences industry. Established in 1999, Valspec's mission is to provide a wide spectrum of services that help its clients meet their capital project and lifecycle maintenance goals.



Valspec's projects are critical to the industry, and to the people who rely on its products. Many projects ensure that life-changing drugs are available to those who need them; others streamline production to meet demand at a lower cost, allowing for the discovery of new and innovative therapies.

**Lead Computer System Validation Engineer**



Location: Remote



Duration: 1-year Contract (Full-time with benefits, potential for extension)



Position Overview:



As the Lead Computer System Validation Engineer, you will take on a pivotal role in spearheading the management of CSV (Computer System Validation) deliverables for new systems and existing applications within the life sciences manufacturing setting. Your expertise will be crucial in ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements, ultimately contributing to the safety of patients.



Key Responsibilities


* Lead the management of CSV deliverables for new systems and existing applications, categorizing GxP and non-validation-requiring systems (NO GMP).
* Oversee and author advanced CSV documentation, including Initial System Assessments, Functional Specifications, Risk Assessments, Design Documents, SOP Planning, Data Integrity Assessments, Traceability Matrices, and various validation protocols (IQ, OQ, PQ), as well as Interim Memos and Validation Summary Reports.
* Collaborate with business units to develop strategic User Requirements, SOPs for administrative tasks related to applications, and protocols for deviations, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.
* Act as a subject matter expert for a variety of systems, including Werum PAS|X, OSM (Optel Serialization), Oracle, Tracelink, Rockwell FactoryTalk, OSI/AVEVA PI, Siemens Desigo, LIMS, Empower, Veeva, ValGenesis, and other similar systems commonly used in the pharmaceutical industry.


Qualifications:


* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in leading the management of CSV deliverables for GxP applications and NO GMP systems in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry.
* In-depth knowledge of regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA 21 CFR Part 11) and industry standards related to CSV.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


* Extensive experience with a range of validated systems such as Werum PAS|X, OSM (Optel Serialization), Oracle, Tracelink, Rockwell FactoryTalk, OSI/AVEVA PI, Siemens Desigo, LIMS, Empower, Veeva, ValGenesis, among others.
* Demonstrated expertise in authoring, developing, and reviewing complex CSV documentation and protocols.


Benefits of Contract Role:


* Competitive compensation with an hourly range of $65 - $90.
* Full-time role with benefits and the potential for contract extension.
* Valuable exposure to the biotechnology/pharmaceutical industry and its leading-edge research.
* Opportunities to play a strategic role in ensuring regulatory compliance through meticulous computer system validation practices.


How to Apply:  

  

If you are a seasoned Lead Computer System Validation Engineer enthusiastic about leveraging your expertise in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry, please submit your resume. We are eager to review your application and potentially welcome you to our team.



Note: The hourly range is an estimate of pay for project-based employment, and we have 3 openings on this team.


Valspec offers a standout culture, fantastic work environment, and has very competitive benefits to include premium medical, 401K match, profit sharing, tuition reimbursement, and other unique incentives.



Candidates must be legally eligible to work in the United States without company sponsorship. Also, we are not interested in working on a corp-to-corp basis with other companies at this time.



Any third-party unsolicited resume submission(s) will immediately become the property of Valspec. Valspec will not pay any fee to a submitting employment agency, person, or entity unless a signed agreement is established.



Valspec is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected class. We are committed to providing a professional environment free of any discrimination or harassment, and we are proud to be a Drug-Free Workplace.

title: MES Engineer
description:
Valspec—a global provider of system validation and lifecycle services—provides commissioning and qualification of computerized systems for clients in the Life Sciences industry. Established in 1999, Valspec's mission is to provide a wide spectrum of services that help its clients meet their capital project and lifecycle maintenance goals.



Valspec's projects are critical to the industry, and to the people who rely on its products. Many projects ensure that life-changing drugs are available to those who need them; others streamline production to meet demand at a lower cost, allowing for the discovery of new and innovative therapies.

**MES Engineer - Recipe Authoring Specialist**



Location: Remote



Job Type: Consulting (Project-Based)


**Position Overview:**



We are seeking a highly skilled MES Engineer with a specialization in recipe authoring to join our consulting team for a project-based assignment with an enterprise life sciences company. In this role, you will play a crucial part in optimizing manufacturing processes within the pharmaceutical and life sciences sector. As an MES Engineer, you will focus on Rockwell FactoryTalk PharmaSuite, Siemens Opcenter Execution Pharma, and Werum PAS|X MES systems, with a strong emphasis on recipe authoring.


**Responsibilities:**


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement MES solutions using Rockwell FactoryTalk PharmaSuite, Siemens Opcenter Execution Pharma, and Werum PAS|X within a life sciences environment.
* Leverage your expertise in recipe authoring to develop, configure, and maintain recipes tailored to specific pharmaceutical processes, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
* Create and implement recipe authoring solutions that comply with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
* Work closely with clients and internal teams to gather and document requirements for MES configurations, with a strong focus on recipe management using Rockwell FactoryTalk PharmaSuite, Siemens Opcenter Execution Pharma, and Werum PAS|X.
* Conduct troubleshooting and provide support for recipe-related issues, ensuring minimal disruption to production processes in environments using these MES platforms.
* Develop and maintain documentation for recipe authoring processes in Rockwell FactoryTalk PharmaSuite, Siemens Opcenter Execution Pharma, and Werum PAS|X, ensuring knowledge transfer within the organization.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field.
* 3+ years of MES engineering experience in the life sciences industry.
* Proven expertise in recipe authoring within Rockwell FactoryTalk PharmaSuite, Siemens Opcenter Execution Pharma, and Werum PAS|X MES systems.
* Strong knowledge of pharmaceutical manufacturing processes, GMP, and regulatory compliance.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to identify and resolve issues related to recipe authoring across multiple MES platforms.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with clients and team members.
* Self-motivated, proactive, and capable of working in a project-based consulting role.


**Benefits:**


* Competitive compensation and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects within the pharmaceutical and life sciences sector, gaining experience with multiple MES platforms, including Rockwell FactoryTalk PharmaSuite, Siemens Opcenter Execution Pharma, and Werum PAS|X.
* Collaborative and dynamic work environment.


Pay Range: $75 - $90 / hour pay range is an estimate of pay for project-based employment. We recognize that talent is key to our success as a company, and aim for the most competitive compensation to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates. The quoted pay range represents our best estimate of what our ideal candidate is likely to expect, based on experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and interpersonal skills. Range varies based on knowledge and experience.



If you are a skilled MES Engineer with a strong background in recipe authoring within the life sciences industry, particularly in Rockwell FactoryTalk PharmaSuite, Siemens Opcenter Execution Pharma, and Werum PAS|X MES systems, we encourage you to apply for this exciting consulting opportunity. Join our team and make a significant impact on the optimization of manufacturing processes for an enterprise life sciences company.


Valspec offers a standout culture, fantastic work environment, and has very competitive benefits to include premium medical, 401K match, profit sharing, tuition reimbursement, and other unique incentives.



Candidates must be legally eligible to work in the United States without company sponsorship. Also, we are not interested in working on a corp-to-corp basis with other companies at this time.



Any third-party unsolicited resume submission(s) will immediately become the property of Valspec. Valspec will not pay any fee to a submitting employment agency, person, or entity unless a signed agreement is established.



Valspec is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected class. We are committed to providing a professional environment free of any discrimination or harassment, and we are proud to be a Drug-Free Workplace.

title: Validation Engineer - Indiana
description:
Valspec—a global provider of system validation and lifecycle services—provides commissioning and qualification of computerized systems for clients in the Life Sciences industry. Established in 1999, Valspec's mission is to provide a wide spectrum of services that help its clients meet their capital project and lifecycle maintenance goals.



Valspec's projects are critical to the industry, and to the people who rely on its products. Many projects ensure that life-changing drugs are available to those who need them; others streamline production to meet demand at a lower cost, allowing for the discovery of new and innovative therapies.

**Validation Engineer (CSV)**



Location: Indianapolis, IN



Provide computer system validation support for a leading contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) specializing in the production of biologics and advanced therapies. We are seeking a flexible and adaptable Validation Engineer (CSV) to represent our team in Indianapolis. In this role, you will be responsible for the validation strategy and SDLC documentation for Emerson DeltaV distributed control system, within the life sciences manufacturing environment.


**Responsibilities**


* Support validation strategies and plans for Emerson DeltaV and PLC-based Fill/Finish systems in compliance with regulatory requirements, industry best practices, and company standards.
* Systems may include Emerson DeltaV, Siemens and Allen-Bradley PLCs, Aveva Wonderware SCADA, and PAS-X MES.
* Lead the creation, review, and approval of validation deliverables, including validation plans, protocols, reports, risk assessments, and traceability matrices.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure appropriate requirements gathering and mapping for validation activities.
* Conduct and oversee FAT (Factory Acceptance Testing), SAT (Site Acceptance Testing), and commissioning activities for DeltaV and Fill/Finish systems.
* Perform risk assessments and impact analyses to identify potential issues and develop mitigation plans.
* Ensure compliance with data integrity requirements and implement measures to maintain data integrity throughout the validation lifecycle.
* Support and provide guidance to the project team regarding CSV (Computer Systems Validation) principles and best practices.
* Liaise with external vendors and contractors to coordinate validation activities and ensure adherence to project timelines.


**Skills and Experience**


* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in CSV and validation within the pharmaceutical or biopharmaceutical industry.
* Strong expertise in validating DeltaV and Fill/Finish systems, including experience with PLCs, SCADA, MES, and Serialization.
* In-depth knowledge of regulatory requirements (FDA, EMA, etc.) and industry standards (GAMP, 21 CFR Part 11) related to CSV and validation.
* Proven experience in developing and executing validation strategies, plans, protocols, and reports.
* Solid understanding of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) and familiarity with Agile methodologies.
* Extensive experience with data integrity principles and implementation in CSV activities.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex systems and processes.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Proactive mindset with a strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
* Experience working in a regulated GxP environment.
* Previous experience in a leadership or mentoring role is highly desirable.


Joining Valspec as a Validation Engineer (CSV) will provide you with an opportunity to make a significant impact in the validation and CSV processes for cutting-edge life sciences manufacturing systems. If you are a highly motivated and detail-oriented professional with a passion for ensuring compliance and data integrity, we encourage you to apply.



Benefits included.


Valspec offers a standout culture, fantastic work environment, and has very competitive benefits to include premium medical, 401K match, profit sharing, tuition reimbursement, and other unique incentives.

title: Central Industrial Engineer
description:
**Who are we?**

  


Since 2004, KIND has been on a mission to create a kinder and healthier world - one snack and one act at a time. Its iconic KIND© bars - made with real, recognizable ingredients - sparked the growth of an entirely new healthy snacking category. Today, KIND has a family of more than 80 snacks that offer solutions for a variety of occasions. All of KIND's products lead with a nutrient-dense first ingredient - whole nuts, whole grains or whole fruit - and do not contain genetically engineered ingredients, sugar alcohols or artificial sweeteners.



Inspired by the belief that acts of kindness can be a transformative force for good, both the KIND brand and The KIND Foundation seek to inspire kindness and empathy.



We're looking for passionate collaborators to help us become the foremost leader in health & wellness and positively impact society along the way. If you're looking to be a part of an inspiring, energetic and entrepreneurial environment, you've found the right place.

  


**What you'll do**



The H&W Platform Central Industrial Engineer (IE) implements the manufacturing and network strategies for the H&W family of brands (KIND, Nature's Bakery, trü frü and future acquisitions), working as a 'catalyst for change' to optimizing performance and drive value leadership initiatives. They shape the manufacturing solutions for the business innovations in line with business priorities and targets.

  


**What you'll bring to KIND**



* **Strategy and Network**
	+ Accountable for network analysis and assessment to shape supply solutions for optimizing cost and efficiency across all North American H&W business units, translating into a 1-to-3-year roadmap.
	+ Lead management of capacity to secure long term product supply through appropriate levels of utilization.
	+ Ensure strategic alignment between supply manufacturing strategy and business and financial targets for all BUs [i.e. COGS improvement, supply manufacturing capability vs growth and innovation ambition]
* **CAB Management**
	+ Accountable for central CAB budget administration - be responsible for tracking actual performance and spend vs plan (liaising between Supply Finance / BU counterparts, central H&W team, and Mars Snacking Global IE team), annual CAB reports and identifying opportunities to drive operational and financial improvements.
	+ Support and lead submission of and gaining of approval for capital investment projects related to capacity and/or innovation activities across H&W.
* **Operational Excellence**
	+ Through internal and external benchmarking, set operational (and hence financial) targets for each technology & enable global review of performance through BU Step 3 reviews.
	+ Drive Value Leadership, initiating and driving game-changing workstreams to optimize our networks and support H&W to become a more efficient, agile, and lean business.
  


**You are...**


* Experienced in Project Management
* Knowledge of Supply Chain and Manufacturing process and procedure, preferentially CPG/Food
* Effective relationship management - internal and external
* Systems knowledge: MS Office (especially excellent Excel knowledge)
* Good verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to travel 10 - 30% of the time

  


**You have...**


* Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering, Engineering, Business Administration or significant equivalent experience.
* At least 3-5 years professional experience in Industrial Engineering, Production or Finance area.

  



Certain states and localities require employers to post a reasonable estimate of salary range. A reasonable estimate of the current base salary range for this position is **$74,000 to $103,000**. Actual salary will be based on a variety of factors, including location, experience, skill set, performance, licensure and certification, and business needs. The range for this position in other geographic locations may differ.

  




**What KIND offers...**



KIND provides a robust benefits package to help support you physically, financially, and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life.


* Competitive salary, including a target bonus and an impressive benefits package!
* Flexible Paid Time Off. Choose what works best for you, including summer hours
* Excellent health, dental & vision insurance, with options to fit you & your family's needs
* Your health is important! Our wellness strategy focuses on mental and physical well-being through in office programs like Drs, Nutritionists, Mindfulness, Chair Massages & others
* Casual office dress code - feel free to wear your KIND gear
* Stock up on your favorite KIND bars to share with your family & friends, through a quarterly voucher
* Training & tuition reimbursement program, because continuing to learn matters and we support your development
* A dynamic, ambitious, fun and KIND work environment
* The opportunity and responsibility to be KIND everyday

  


**EEO**



At KIND, we are committed to an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is championed. KIND is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and we are an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require special accommodation, please let us know.

  


**Privacy Policy**



KIND promises that our products will always lead with a nutrient-dense first ingredient, such as nuts, whole grains or fruit – a disruptive notion that sparked the creation of a new healthy snacking category. We aim to challenge the status quo within the food industry and empower our community to make better, informed choices about health. To view KIND's Privacy Policy in its entirety please follow this link: https://www.kindsnacks.com/privacy-policy.html



To view your privacy choices please follow this link.

title: Risk Engineer Sr. Consultant - Hanover Specialty Industrial
description:
For more than 170 years, The Hanover has been committed to delivering on our promises and being there when it matters the most. We live our values every day, demonstrating we CARE through our values, ESG initiatives and IDE journey.
  
  

Our Hanover Specialty Industrial team is seeking a Risk Engineer Sr. Consultant to join its growing team. This is a full time, exempt role. This is a remote opportunity.
  
  

Our ideal candidate will be located in Michigan, however, any qualified candidate living near a major airport is encouraged to apply.
  
  

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**  

Operates semi-autonomously regarding core competencies including, but not limited to, day-to-day risk engineering and insured support activities within a commensurate level of experience. Conducts property risk engineering field inspections of existing and limited prospective policyholders including consulting with customers regarding solutions to identified property risk engineering exposures/ deficiencies. Demonstrates a broad knowledge and expertise across the Risk Engineering spectrum. Occasionally provides guidance to lesser experienced field consultants to provide guidance.
  
  

**IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:**  

* Perform risk engineering site inspections of existing and limited prospective. policyholders with all levels of complexity.
* Generate technical property risk engineering reports designed to identify property risk engineering exposures and recommend appropriate controls to minimize the frequency and magnitude of potential losses.
* Collaborate with Risk Analysts to assist insureds in solving/resolving identified property risk engineering deficiencies.
* Occasionally partner with the Technical/Project Specialist on various projects and initiatives within the risk engineering department to further develop technical knowledge of the processes and controls specific to the operations conducted at insured locations.
* Partner periodically with less experienced Risk Engineering Field Consultants as a mentor as part of their continued development to build skills in report generation and performing audits/managing accounts of increasing complexity.
* Regularly coordinates with internal and external resources on risks of all levels of complexity.
* Conduct property risk engineering field inspections of existing and prospective policyholders including consulting with customers regarding solutions to identified property risk engineering exposures/deficiencies; Workload may fluctuate based on territory and/or experience level.
* Generate technical property risk engineering reports and other related documents in conjunction with the field inspections carried out as outlined in the first bullet item.
* Provide input and contributing in the completion of various risk engineering related projects.
* Mentor junior Risk Engineering Consultants.


**WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY:**  

* Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering discipline preferred.
* 8-12 years in technical and/or engineering related experience.
* Strong understanding of NFPA Codes and Standards or equivalent (Factory Mutual Guidelines)
* Must be able to travel by car or plane.
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel.
* Good command of fundamental and advanced technical concepts, practices, and procedures.
* Excellent communication skills including the ability to communicate difficult or technical decisions with confidence and precision.
* Consistently demonstrates high level of proficiency across HSIP Risk Engineering core competencies.


**CAREER DEVELOPMENT:**  

It’s not just a job, it’s a career, and we are here to support you every step of the way. We want you to be successful and fulfilled. Through on-the-job experiences, personalized coaching and our robust learning and development programs, we encourage you – at every level – to grow and develop.
  
  

**BENEFITS:**  

We offer comprehensive benefits to help you be healthy, build financial security, and balance work and home life. At The Hanover, you’ll enjoy what you do and have the support you need to succeed.
  
  

**Benefits include:**  

* Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
* 401K with a company match
* Tuition reimbursement
* PTO
* Company paid holidays
* Flexible work arrangements
* Cultural Awareness Day in support of IDE
* On-site medical/wellness center (Worcester only)
* Click here for the full list of Benefits


**EEO statement:**  

The Hanover values diversity in the workplace and among our customers. The company provides equal opportunity for employment and promotion to all qualified employees and applicants on the basis of experience, training, education, and ability to do the available work without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex/gender, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, ancestry or any other status protected by law.
  
  

Furthermore, The Hanover Insurance Group is committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace that is free of discrimination and harassment based on national origin, race, color, religion, gender, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by law.”
  
  

As an equal opportunity employer, Hanover does not discriminate against qualified individuals with disabilities. Individuals with disabilities who wish to request a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, or to perform essential job functions, should contact us at: HRServices@hanover.com and include the link of the job posting in which you are interested.
  
  

**Privacy Policy:**  

To view our privacy policy and online privacy statement, click here.
  
  

**Applicants who are California residents:** To see the types of information we may collect from applicants and employees and how we use it, please click here.

**Plan and lead line trials and qualification of flexible films for snacks – mainly on VFFS bagmakers. Be able to troubleshoot film and machine interactions issues. Trials will be either qualifying current film specifications with new suppliers, qualifying alternative films with current suppliers, or qualifying new films for new products.**
