* **Good communication skills both oral and written**

title: (REMOTE) Sr. Performance Management Consultant - Revenue Excellence
description:
**Employment Type:**
Full time**Shift:**
Day Shift**Description:*****Position allows for remote or work from home opportunity.***


Knows, understands, incorporates, and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices, and decisions.


Provides depth of knowledge and seasoned expertise in one to two specific areas within the Revenue Cycle, along with a solid understanding of end-to-end Revenue Cycle processes and the ability to identify opportunities for performance improvement. Serves as an expert with knowledge of best known practices in at least one functional area. Monitors and enhances existing tools to support owned functional area


Leads projects and manages deliverables required to support the performance management team functions. Serves as a primary point of contact in the resolution of significant project issues and removal of project barriers.


Responsible for developing plans and strategies, setting standards, identifying outcomes and resolving performance management team issues. Monitors and drives progress of teams in meeting project deliverables and ensuring alignment with organizational goals.


Identifies and prepares operational and financial metrics and provides appropriate interpretation and application of data. Designs, develops and implements systems that provide financial, statistical and operational information.


Responsible for complex and specialized assignments requiring the application of deep analytical and practical guidance and direction. Serves as a technical resource providing seasoned and specialized knowledge and adaptive thinking in response to a variety of situations and challenges. Develops integrated solutions to resolve highly complex technical and business issues.


Provides advisory leadership and seasoned guidance coordinating projects, adhering to established methodology, managing deliverables, addressing risk factors, removing barriers and providing problem resolution in meeting project plan deliverables. Identifies areas that present challenges and opportunities; makes recommendations that provide practical options and solutions while considering the impact on processes, workforce, culture and technology.


Facilitates varied interests, cross functional teams and groups through effective leadership, communication, collaboration and negotiation abilities in order to achieve mutual agreeable solutions.


Defines and manages project plans and goals; conducts business workflow mapping; impact analyses and modeling; applies action steps, develops status reports or communication plans and keeps leadership and key stakeholders apprised of project progress and ensuring project plans and deliverables are met and in alignment with organizational goals


Management of vendor relations supporting revenue cycle functions across region.


Identifies deviations from best known practice performance and processes.


Utilizes critical thinking, strong analytical skills and proficient abilities with Microsoft Excel.


Independently collects, synthesizes and analyzes data, identifies root cause, and provides summaries and graphical presentations of data illustrating trends with recommended next steps to manager.


Identifies and escalates performance opportunities, initiates action plans, and serves as the primary point of contact for RHM and PBS managers


Other duties as needed and assigned by the manager.


Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health’s Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct, as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical, and professional behavior.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**
Must possess a strong knowledge of revenue cycle strategies, as normally obtained through a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Industrial Engineering or Healthcare Administration or a related field, and five (5) or more years of revenue cycle experience, project management or consulting experience with healthcare clients driving transformational efforts or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


Knowledge of and experience with Health Information Systems and insurance issues, healthcare industry issues and trends, legal issues in field of expertise, required third party and governmental guidelines, and work processing methods and techniques.


Supervisory or team leader experience that emphasize team‑building and strong leadership with the ability to provide clear oversight and coordination to the department, while also functioning as an individual contributor. Proven ability to develop analysis and process improvement recommendations to create solutions that drives measurable desired results.


Demonstrated experience and proficiency in managing performance/business process improvement activities and applying continuous improvement methodologies, including analyzing workflow processes utilizing PDCA, Lean, Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies. Ability to train and mentor others.


Strong project management , integration and implementation abilities. Reasonable experience in planning, formulating and executing strategies and to define project, process or business objectives and scope. Prior responsibility for managing change management projects and interfacing with leadership.


Demonstrated proficiency to identify, evaluate and articulate operational opportunities, business needs and gaps, plan and implement project steps, understand stakeholder interest and provide authoritative consultation.


Excellent organizational, advanced analytical, presentation, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Ability to translate technical matters to operations staff, facilitate communications between diverse groups and to effectively assess and facilitate improvements and solutions and to provide productive working partnerships, advice and authoritative recommendations to all levels of the organization.


Proven customer-service orientation and strong interpersonal, consultative and relationship building skills. Ability to know and understand customer requirements and exercise judgment in meeting reasonable expectations, particularly when differences of opinion on needs and services, unanticipated contingencies or divergent ideas and perspectives exist. Ability to influence results, garner support and tactfully manage complex relationships and influences within and across the organization. Ability to read the subtle nuances of situations and react/plan accordingly.


Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.


Experience with RC analytics, key metrics and leading indicators of RC performance, and visualization tools (i.e. Tableau).


Ability to work independently or as a team member.


Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment.


Must possess a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health.

**PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS**
This position operates in a typical office environment. The area is well lit, temperature controlled and free from hazards.


Incumbent communicates frequently, in person and over the phone, with people in all locations on product support issues.


Manual dexterity is needed to operate a keyboard. Hearing is needed for extensive telephone and in person communication.


The environment in which the incumbent will work requires the ability to concentrate, meet deadlines, work on several projects at the same time and adapt to interruptions.


Must be able to set and organize own work priorities, and adapt to them as they change frequently. Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of tasks/projects in an environment that may be stressful with individuals having diverse personalities and work styles.


Must be able to travel to various Trinity Health sites as needed.


Must possess the ability to comply with Trinity Health policies and procedures.

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**

  

Trinity Health is one of the largest not-for-profit, Catholic healthcare systems in the nation. Built on the foundation of our Mission and Core Values, we integrate diversity, equity, and inclusion in all that we do. Our colleagues have different lived experiences, customs, abilities, and talents. Together, we become our best selves. A diverse and inclusive workforce provides the most accessible and equitable care for those we serve. Trinity Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law.

title: Technical Analyst
description:
**Perks & Benefits:**



At KCF, we are committed to providing best-in-class benefits, engaging development opportunities, and powerful perks that are focused on bringing out the best in you.



Full-time benefits include:


* 100% company-paid Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life Insurance premiums
* Health Savings Account with generous employer contributions
* Flexible work model for most positions, "work from home, work from anywhere"
* Competitive compensation & bonus opportunities
* Four weeks Paid Time Off; Paid Holidays + "Flex" Holiday
* 401(K) with company match
* Monthly cell phone and internet stipend
* $500 annual wellness reimbursement
* Learning culture committed to growth and continuous development

  


**Mission & Values:**



KCF Technologies exists to solve the world's machine health problems to drive safety and sustainability for our communities. We empower industry to eradicate downtime, waste, and injuries with KCF's Machine Health Solutions Platform. Learn more at www.kcftech.com



Curious about what working at KCF is really like? Explore Life at KCF here! If you're an A-player who wants to be part of one of the most important companies revitalizing machine health across the world, KCF is the place for you. If our values resonate with you, please keep reading!



Core Values:



Smarts: We are humbly aggressive lifelong learners.



Grit: We are scrappy, proactive problem solvers who don't stop until the job is done.



Drive: We demonstrate an insatiable hunger to serve others.



Responsibility: We do the right thing and contribute to the greater good.



Autonomy: We own our work and define how we do it, while aligned with the greater mission.

 **Where You Come In:**



We are currently seeking a **Technical Analyst** to join our growing team! As a Technical Analyst/Engineer on the KCF Team, you'll have the opportunity to work on a collaborative team of engineers in one of the most exciting fields in technology!



Technical Analysts/Engineers help our industrial customers remotely and continuously monitor their factory equipment to prevent unplanned failures and optimize operation to extend machine life. Technology and data analysis provide the backbone for delivering actionable advice to customers, so your ability to learn vibration and other types of machine health analysis is key. Our team will provide you the detailed training you need, but you need to bring the capability and desire to absorb the training and become an expert. Personal interaction is key; we focus on *relationship-building* and *establishing trust* with our customers so that they are excited to work with us to improve their plant's operation, making their jobs easier and more valuable.



This engineering role has the ability to be **remote** from your current location in the US, and travel requirements may vary depending on your current location. Any industry or vibration analysis experience you bring to the table is a major plus and will accelerate your ability to succeed.



This is starting to sound like your next challenge, right? Read on for more info!

  


**Essential Functions:**


* Deliver SENTRY machine health solution services to KCF SMARTdiagnostics customers
	+ Configure and maintain customer SMARTdiagnostics machine health platform including set up of alarm limits and notification criteria, asset details, pictures, event logging, user access, etc.
	+ Provide SMARTdiagnostics machine health platform coaching and training to facilitate customer engagement
	+ Perform remote asset health monitoring of customer equipment
	+ Create and deliver SENTRY Reports at required frequency per contract that provide actionable insights, root cause analysis, action item prioritization, and success metric tracking
* Utilize KCF's methods to document and track customer value
* Stay current on safety certifications as customers require (expenses covered by KCF)
* Maintain a professional image that reflects the company's culture
* Promptly respond to customer requests
* Communicate with customers directly and demonstrate autonomy and responsibility
* Field general inquiries regarding KCF products and services
* Travel as necessary to customer sites, training events, etc. (up to 20%)

  


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, physical science, or similar
* 2-3 years industry-specific experience preferred (Midstream Oil and Gas a plus)
* Vibration Analysis experience strongly preferred
* Mechanical aptitude, engineering mindset, hands-on experience, and enjoyment of learning how things work
* Superior communication skills; written, face-to-face, and over the phone
* Able, willing, and excited to travel and maneuver through large industrial plants
* Ability to travel up to 20%

  


At KCF Technologies, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. The only things we require for employment, compensation, advancement and benefits are performance and a good team attitude. No one will be denied opportunities or benefits, and no employment decisions will be made, on the basis of race, religion/creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, disability that does not prohibit performance of essential job functions, protected veteran status, medical condition, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, possession of a general education development certificate ("GED") as compared to a high school diploma, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal or state laws. KCF complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which KCF has facilities.

title: Product Manager - TMS (Remote)
description:
**Job Summary:**


The Product Manager is the member of the product team embedded with the development team providing product support through the full lifecycle of software development. Responsible for translating the product vision and roadmap to the team and making it actionable for the team through authoring Agile stories and organizing them into sprints. Manages sprint outcomes to meet committed deadlines and validating that delivered features meet customer needs and the highest quality standards. Supports implementation of the features through documentation, issue management and subject matter expertise.

 **Job Expectations:**

* Translate product vision and roadmap priorities to technical teams
* Define and document business requirements and functional specifications from business users and subject matter experts
* Maintain and groom product backlog ensuring user stories are well formed with effective acceptance criteria
* Support prioritization and negotiation of features and deadlines applying a thorough understanding of customer needs and business and technical requirements
* Work with the development team to ensure feature traceability into the technical designs
* Take leadership role in estimation, sprint planning, daily scrum and retrospective meetings
* Communicate and coordinate within and across teams on proposed solutions, status and timelines
* Deliver internal and external product training on new features, enhancements or modules
* Evaluate and report system performance
* Gather data and metrics to drive projects and measure success based on business value
* Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT); write test plans as required
* Perform customer demos of new processes


The duties and responsibilities described above may provide only a partial description of this position. This is not an exhaustive list of all aspects of the job. Other duties and responsibilities not outlined in this document may be added as necessary or desirable, with or without notice.

 **Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

**Required:**

* Expertise designing and implementing Transportation Management System modules.
* Strong background and understanding of the global logistics process including but not limited to carrier integration, freight forwarder integration, end to end parcel movement cycle, import/export regulation and compliance.
* Experience in leading Business Analysis, Business Process Design and Application Development (SDLC)
* Experience in Agile, Scrum and iterative development
* Strong background in designing/writing User Stories, Epics, and other design/requirement artifacts
* Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast paced environment
* Customer first mentality with the knowledge to work with internal groups to improve business processes
* Excellent written/verbal communication and must work well with others
* Experience working closely with C-level users throughout the implementation life-cycle
* Experience with global retail e-commerce or supply chain companies
* Background in Industrial Engineering or Software Development

**Equipment Knowledge:**

* Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Experience with Google Business Suite (Gmail, Drive, Docs, Sheets, Forms) preferred
* Experience with Lucid chart
* Experience with Jira
* Experience with Asana

**Experience Requirements:**  

Generally requires three (3) plus years of TMS design and implementation experience  

  

**Education Requirements:**  

Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering, Logistics, Supply Chain, or Computer Science related fields is preferred or equivalent work experience

**Judgment/Reasoning Ability:**


Able to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems quickly using sound judgment, poise and diplomacy. Ability to use judgment and reasoning skills, and determine when to escalate issues, as required, in a timely manner.

**Physical Demands:**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the Team Member is regularly required to talk and hear. The Team Member is frequently required to sit, walk, climb stairs, use hands and fingers, bend, stoop and reach with hands and arms. Reaching above shoulder heights, below the waist or lifting as required to file documents or store materials throughout the work day. The Team Member may occasionally lift or move office products and supplies up to 25 pounds. Proper lifting techniques required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 **Work Environment:**

**The noise in the work environment is usually moderate. Other factors are:**

* Hectic, fast-paced with multi-level distractions
* Professional, yet casual work environment
* Office / Warehouse environment
* Ability to work extended hours as required


#LI-JC1


The anticipated pay scale for this position can be found below, however the pay range applicable to you may vary by geographic location based on where the job is located or where you work. The final pay offered to a successful candidate will be dependent on several factors that may include but are not limited to the type and years of experience within the job, the type of years and experience within the industry, education, etc. iHerb, LLC is a multi-state employer and this pay scale may not reflect positions that work in other states or locations.  

  

Employees (and their families) that meet eligibility criteria as outlined in applicable plan documents are eligible to participate in our medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance programs and may enroll in our company's 401(k) plan. $139,020—$215,903 USD

iHerb does not accept unsolicited 3rd party ("Agency") candidates. If requested to work on a role, any Agency candidates would be presented through the internal recruiting organization.



**About iHerb**  

iHerb is on a mission to make health and wellness accessible to all. We offer Earth's best-curated selection of health and wellness products, at the best possible value, delivered with the most convenient experience.  

  

We're the world's largest eCommerce platform dedicated to vitamins, minerals, and supplements, and other health and wellness products. For more than 25 years, we've been making it simple for people all over the world to purchase the highest quality products. From supplements to skincare to grocery items, we ship over 30,000 products, from over 1,200 brands direct to our customers in 185+ countries.  

  

Our vision is to become the #1 destination for health and wellness across the world.  

  

With a passion for wellness and a mind for innovative solutions, iHerb team members share a vision for a healthier world that drives them each day. Our 5 Shared Values unite our global team:


**Focus on the Customer · Empower Our People · Be Entrepreneurial & Pivot Quickly ·**  

**Embrace Diversity & Inclusion · Strive for Simplicity**

  


**iHerb Benefits**  

At iHerb, we are dedicated to offering programs designed to help our employees and their families stay healthy, live well, and plan for their financial future. Built on a strong foundation, our programs provide options and upgrades with flexibility, protection, and security in mind. For the comprehensive benefits list, visit www.iHerbBenefits.com. For our international team members, you may be eligible for benefits depending on the country where you are employed. The Talent Acquisition Partner/local HR representative will go over the benefits you are eligible for.



iHerb is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. iHerb provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment.

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
*AssetWatch serves global manufacturers by powering manufacturing uptime through the delivery of an unparalleled condition monitoring experience, with a passion to care about the assets our customers care for every day. We are a devoted and capable team that includes world-renowned engineers and distinguished business leaders united by a common goal – To build the future of predictive maintenance. As we enter the next phase of rapid growth, we are seeking people to help lead the journey.*



You are passionate about building great products and highly organized, with a strong dedication to details and follow-through enabling you to work effectively on a distributed remote team. You can execute product development steps independently, manage projects, maintain project schedules, and communicate progress toward objectives in a fast-paced development environment.


**What You'll Do:**


* Responsible for electronic designs of existing and future AssetWatch products
* Work on your own, and in conjunction with internal and external partners to develop electronic products, custom PCBAs, firmware, test fixtures, processes, and refinements to existing products.
* Ensure sound manufacturing methods, system performance, regulatory compliance and documentation is satisfied on all products.
* Responsible for component DFM/A and BOM detailing, drawings, instructions, and specifying OTS parts in coordination with the Supply Chain team.
* Develop custom PCBs in Altium, perform circuit analysis/simulation, develop production ready firmware, build, test/validate prototypes, and help guide new products to production


**Who You Are:**

* 5+ years strong electrical engineering fundamentals including analog, digital, and RF designs
* Strong teamwork skills with the ability to collaborate with multiple functional teams across a variety of fields
* Ability to analyze solutions and make system design trade-offs
* Familiarity with the challenges of taking a product from early architecture through to production
* Understanding of signal/power integrity and low voltage power regulation and delivery
* Able to thrive on new challenges in a fast-paced agile environment
* Able to balance between the perfect solution and timely execution
* Exceptional attention to detail and organization skills
* Strong experience developing consumer or industrial products
* Experience in the following areas:
* Designing products to industry standards (FCC, UL, CE, MIC, IEC)
* Designing custom circuits and firmware for low power electronics
* Experience with C/C++, Python, and Spice
* Use of lab equipment including oscilloscopes, signal analyzers, benchtop power supplies/profilers, and soldering equipment
* Testing and debugging hardware and firmware
* Understanding of primary and secondary power sources
* Strong knowledge of manufacturing and production methods including PCB fabrication, assembly, ICT, and end of line testing
* Knowledge of manufacturing engineering from drawings and revision control to DFM/DFA
* Hands-on experience building, breaking and fixing real products
* Have shipped a real-world hardware product at scale
* Experience working with domestic/overseas manufacturing partners
* Experience designed for hazardous locations (ATEX, HAZLOC, or similar)
* Expertise in designing for industrial and safety regulated environments
* Experience building Internet of Things (IoT) devices
* Experience working with a startup culture is preferred


**What We Offer:**



AssetWatch is a remote-first rapidly growing startup providing a game changing condition monitoring platform and mobile experience in the industrial manufacturing space.


* Competitive compensation package including bonus & equity
* Flexible work schedule
* Full benefits and 401K
* Opportunity to make a real impact every day
* Opportunity to work with an exciting and growing team
* Unlimited PTO


We have a distributed team that works remotely across locations in the United States. We are open to candidates from most states but collaboration within core working hours is required.

title: Beverage/Water Quality Engineer II - 100% Remote
description:
At Niagara, we’re looking for Team Members who want to be part of achieving our mission to provide our customers the highest quality most affordable bottled water.


Consider applying here, if you want to:

* Work in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact.
* Develop lasting relationships with great people.
* Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career.


We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages for our Team Members.


Beverage/Water Quality Engineer II - 100% Remote
The Quality Engineer II will be responsible for the Beverage Quality, Water Quality, and Sanitation Quality Systems. The Quality Engineer will create and maintain Quality Assurance (QA) standard operating procedures, work with management representatives at all manufacturing plants, communicate quality system changes, create training work instructions, and collaborate closely with plant teams and department managers to ensure the system supports overall company goals.

**Essential Functions**

* Quality Process Improvement – Performs quality focused engineering duties in the development and application of quality tools, methods, and systems that result in continual product quality improvements. Participates in the Quality Assurance functions within the manufacturing division by assisting in developing, implementing and administering quality specifications, test methodologies, and sampling plans for product and process.
* Project Work – Works with various Quality and Manufacturing representatives on developing and completing project requests to improve quality throughout the Niagara network.
* Data Collection and Analysis – Collects, analyzes, and presents Quality data for trending and for the development of Quality Performance Indicators. Applies statistical process control (SPC) methods for analyzing data to evaluate the current process and process changes. Develops new approaches to solve problems identified during quality assurance activities.
* Communication – Communicates significant issues or developments identified during quality assurance activities and provide recommended process improvements to management.
* CI and Lean - Drives lean manufacturing and continuous improvement principles throughout the organization using value stream mapping and other lean tools.
* Training – Participates in and conducts ongoing training in the areas of Quality Assurance, lean manufacturing and Six Sigma. Assists in new plant start-ups, new line installs, performing training and standardization for new QA teams.
* Lead beverage project rollouts, this could include new beverage scale-ups, rollouts or implementations. Identify and resolve any outstanding engineering problems associated with running a new beverage product. Create new beverage specification documents to detail how new products should be produced/processed in order to ensure appropriate quality levels throughout production.
* Lean Six Sigma (LSS) Projects – Ability to lead LSS projects across multiple plants and departments. Understand LSS methodologies to drive continuous efforts to improve process efficiencies and reduce waste. A focus on achieving measureable and quantifiable financial returns for the company.
* New Plant Start-ups – This position will participate extensively with New Plant Start-ups. They will be an on-site resource for these start-ups providing training, and expertise to the plant staff. This will also include new line start-ups where necessary.
* **Travel**
	+ **50% - on average travels 2 weeks out of the month**

* *Please note this job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without prior notice.*

**Qualifications**

* Minimum Qualifications:
	+ 2 Years – Experience in Quality Engineering
	+ 2 Years – Experience in Plant Level QA


***\\*experience may include a combination of work experience and education***

* Travel
	+ **50% - on average travels 2 weeks out of the month**

* Preferred Qualifications:
	+ 4 Years – Experience in Quality Engineering
	+ 4 Years – Experience in SQL, ODBC, and PLC Programming
	+ 2 Years – Experience in Plant Quality Manager
	+ 2 Years – Experience in Beverage Quality
* ***experience may include a combination of work experience and education***

**Competencies**


Proficiency in, but not limited to:

* Experience and knowledge of Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma methodology principles.
* Experience with statistical process control software.
* Experience in manufacturing plants and knowledge of plant processes.
* Demonstrated skill with information systems and technology trends.
* Ability to communicate effectively with different levels of personal.
* Ability to lead projects to completion and work effectively without direct supervision
* Familiarity with the following:
	+ Reverse Osmosis
	+ Beverage Batching Operations
	+ Beverage CIP and Sanitation Operations
	+ Bottle Water Production
	+ PET Blow molding
	+ Plastic Injection
	+ General Microbiology Practices
	+ Chemical Analysis Techniques

**Education**

* Minimum Required:
	+ Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Food Science, Chemistry or Science related field
* Preferred:
	+ Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Chemical), Food Science or Science related field

title: Industrial & Systems Engineer II - Remote
description:
McLane, a wholly owned unit of Berkshire Hathaway Inc, is one of the largest supply chain services leaders in the United States, providing grocery and foodservice solutions for convenience stores, mass merchants, drug stores and chain restaurants. Through McLane Grocery and McLane Foodservice, McLane operates over 80 distribution centers. We are looking for talented Industrial Engineers to join our remote team supporting our distribution center initiatives typically related to cost reduction and productivity improvements. A few of these exciting initiatives include companywide initiatives and network wide projects related to cost reduction and productivity improvements, act as a subject matter expert for DC Operations. Perform operational and transportation analysis, continuous process improvements, engineered labor standards (ELS) updates, warehouse management system configuration as well as facility and capacity planning.  

  

**COMPENSATION:**  

* $89,000 to $99,000 base salary (commensurate with experience), plus 12.5% bonus potential

  

**BENEFITS:**  

* Medical, Dental, Vision coverage available on Day 1
* Paid time-off
* 401(k) with annual company match.

  

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS / PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:**  

* Create and Manage Project Scheduling with internal and external project teams.
* Support companywide operations and special projects.
* Develop and implement improved Standard Operating Procedures with Corporate Engineering.
* Partner with division operations to reinforce consistent process execution and identify opportunities for process improvement.
* Assess and optimize processes and equipment within the facility and region to support business needs.
* Implement and support McLane's warehouse, labor, execution and slotting optimization systems.
* Report and engage senior operational and engineering leaders and stakeholders to gain alignment on implementation plans and success metrics.
* Manage medium-scale material handling projects from conception through startup to ensure on time, under budget and performance objective results are met.
* Develop efficient layouts, workstations, and material handling systems for new and existing facilities.
* Maintain current and accurate documentation of systems.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

  

**MINIMUM SKILLS AND QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Industrial and Systems Engineering preferred, other applicable degrees with accompanying experience will be considered.
* 4 or more years' experience as a regional or on-site industrial engineer required.
* Experience with Manhattan WMOS and LMS or JDA/Red Prairie WMS and LMS (preferred).
* Experience within distribution facility layout, racking layout and design required.
* Understanding of distribution center operations to include receiving, selection, replenishment, routing and dispatch.
* Strong oral and written communication skills with ability to advocate for and present recommendations to senior leadership.
* Ability to function in a fast-paced office and warehouse environment in a professional manner.
* Strong Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, and Project.
* Experience with Statistical Analysis and Operations Research required.

  

**Environment:**  

* Distribution Center
* Remote with Travel

  

Candidates may be subject to a background check and drug screen, in accordance with applicable laws.  

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Reliability Engineer
description:
**Title: Reliability Engineer II**

Location: Phoenix, AZ, US, 85004-2121

**Please note:** This position has the possibility to work remotely up to 100% of the time. The position will require occasional travel to the Phoenix corporate offices and/or site locations . This position may be performed anywhere in the U.S. except California, Connecticut, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Michigan, Illinois, Kentucky and New York. Additional states may be excluded from remote work based on business factors. Should the positions shift to in-office work in the future, the company will offer relocation benefits at that time should the position meet the established eligibility for these benefits.

**Why You Should Apply For This Job:** 

**Freeport-McMoRan** is a leading international mining company with headquarters in Phoenix, Arizona. We operate large, long-lived, geographically diverse assets with significant proven and probable reserves of copper, gold, and molybdenum. The company has a dynamic portfolio of operating, expansion and growth projects in the copper industry. Freeport-McMoRan is one of the world’s largest publicly traded copper producers, the world’s largest producer of molybdenum and a significant gold producer. We have a long and successful history of conducting our business in a safe, highly efficient and socially-responsible manner.

We have the assets, the talent, the drive and the financial strength to provide attractive and rewarding careers of our employees. We encourage you to take the time to explore the opportunity to advance your career at Freeport-McMoRan.

**Description:** Under general supervision, provides technical advice and guidance for designated Reliability Engineering projects and programs at assigned site.

* Review, investigate, and develop appropriate recommendations regarding assigned Reliability Engineering projects
* With minimum supervision utilizing new technology to constantly upgrade and improve site safety, efficiencies, cost controls, quality controls and protection of the environment
* Participate with Operations and Maintenance departments and other Engineering staff in problem solving efforts to improve safety, efficiencies, cost controls and protection of the environment
* Coordinate project activities with Operations and Maintenance departments to improve equipment maintenance availability and other KPIs
* Ensure appropriate documentation for assigned projects are prepared and review documentation for accuracy
* Participate on small to medium site construction, expansion or modification projects
* Administer contracts with vendors for the provision of services and equipment
* Develop working knowledge of local, state and federal regulations appropriate to area of assignment
* Perform other duties as required

**Qualifications**

**Minimum Qualifications**

*This position requires international air travel. In accordance with Freeport-McMoRan’s requirement for all employees whose job requires international travel, if you are hired you will be required to submit proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to travel by air internationally, unless the company has granted a medical or religious accommodation.*

* Bachelor's degree in related Engineering discipline **and** three (3) years of related experience in Engineering, **OR**
* Master's degree in related Engineering discipline **and** two (2) years of related experience in Engineering
* Knowledge in probability and statistical analysis
* Knowledge of the principles and practices of Reliability Engineering
* Able to research and analyze information of considerable difficulty and draw valid conclusions
* Ability to develop and maintain awareness of occupational hazards and safety precautions
* Skilled in following safety practices and recognizing hazards
* Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering
* Completion of Reliability Engineering courses
* SMRP or CMRP Certification
* Six Sigma experience or Certification

**Criteria/Conditions**

* Ability to understand and apply verbal and written work and safety-related instructions and procedures given in English
* Ability to communicate in English with respect to job assignments, job procedures, and applicable safety standards
* Must be able to work in a potentially stressful environment
* Occasionally may be required to lift moderately heavy objects up to thirty (30) pounds during the course of the workday
* Personal protective equipment is required when performing work in a mine, outdoor, manufacturing or plant environment, including hard hat, hearing protection, safety glasses, safety footwear, and as needed, respirator, rubber steel-toe boots, protective clothing, gloves and any other protective equipment as required
* Freeport-McMoRan promotes a drug/alcohol free work environment through the use of mandatory pre-employment drug testing and on-going random drug testing

At Freeport, we are committed to providing an employment package that recognizes excellence, rewards value and impact, and encourages safe production. Benefits and compensation are foundational elements of this package, along with career development opportunities, job progression and a culture supported by our core values, among others. Learn more at: FCX Jobs - Working Here

**Benefits:**

We provide an industry-leading benefits package with some of the lowest cost to employees – offering health, wellness, life insurance, paid time off, retirement savings and more. These benefits are available to you and your dependents starting day one. Our comprehensive benefits program is important to how we support the health and wellness of employees and their families. For further benefits information please click here: **Benefits Details**

**Compensation:**

The estimated annual pay range for this role is currently **$84,000-$116,000.** This range reflects base salary only and does not include bonus payments, benefits or retirement contributions. Actual base pay is determined by experience, qualifications, skills and other job-related factors. This role is eligible for additional discretionary and incentive payment considerations based on company and individual performance. More details will be shared during the hiring process. To view an example of a Total Rewards Estimate for this role click here: **Total Rewards Estimate**

**Safety / Work Conditions:**

Candidates will be required to participate in a post-offer, pre-employment medical examination for the following positions which may have essential job duties that can impact both their own safety and the safety of others:

* Site-based positions, or positions which require unescorted access to site-based operational areas, which are held by employees who are required to receive MSHA, OSHA, DOT, HAZWOPER and/or Hazard Recognition Training; or
* Positions which are held by employees who operate equipment, machinery or motor vehicles in furtherance of performing the essential functions of their job duties, including operating motor vehicles while on Company business or travel (for this purpose “motor vehicles” includes Company owned or leased motor vehicles and personal motor vehicles used by employees in furtherance of Company business or while on Company travel).

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Industrial Engineer - United States
description:
***\\*\\*This is not a remote position. This position requires you relocate to Butte MT\\*\\****

Job Description

Resodyn is seeking a passionate, detail-oriented **Industrial Engineer** to evaluate our current operations and to establish more efficient and systematic production processes. The **Industrial Engineer's** responsibilities include analyzing operations, designing workflows and production processes, reducing inefficiency, and ensuring that final products meet established quality standards.

The successful candidate must have a proven background with efficient systems that integrate workers, machines, materials, information hardware development, and implementation knowhow for the manufacture of complex products. Candidate must have a BSIE, MSIE, or equivalent engineering discipline with a minimum of 5 years of experience.

This is a unique opportunity for a qualified individual in a technologically diverse organization that offers broad manufacturing management opportunities for the fabrication of multiple existing products and will include new products that are under development.

Objectives of this Role

* Analyze and evaluate existing systems and processes, identifying value-added and non-value-added activities to solve design challenges
* Conceive, design, test, and develop innovative solutions based on analysis and organizational objectives
* Evaluate and explore new and existing processes, equipment, and materials as an input to scheduling methods, performance metrics and financial standards
* Foster Resodyn’s reputation by delivering innovative solutions while upholding company, federal, and state regulations
* Manage and conduct employee training for productivity improvement projects, and mentor fellow engineers and technicians

Responsibilities

* Review engineering specifications
* Develop management controls systems
* Determine how to conduct and deliver manufacturing services with maximum efficiency
* Participate in research to determine the qualified places to have manufacture components
* Utilize principles of mathematics, science, and engineering to streamline processes Identify opportunities to prevent waste and inefficiency in production
* Research and test design ideas to determine feasibility, utilizing Lean Manufacturing, Kaizen, Six Sigma, and root cause analysis to formulate/support innovation, corrective actions, and continuous improvement activities
* Develop and design robust manufacturing concepts to simplify/improve manufacturing processes to ensure best practice
* Institute quality control procedures to resolve quality control procedures
* Create and maintain required manufacturing process documentation including detailed work instructions, process flow charts, capacity and utilization studies, time and motion studies, standard work, cycle time analysis and line balancing
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gain insight and direction to successfully complete projects

Skills and Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering (IE or ME), Master’s degree preferred
* 5+ years related engineering/management experience
* In-depth understanding of lean manufacturing principles
* Experience with building prototypes
* Proficiency with analytical tools, workflow time study, and process balancing
* Ability to interface with program management, manufacturing leads, customer, and functional leads; provide daily direction and guidance to junior associates and management
* Advanced experience using MS suite, including Access, Excel, and PowerPoint
* Experience with the implementation and use of ERP systems
* Strong project and event scheduling skills
* Ability to communicate effectively
* Experience working on multidisciplinary teams
* Creative problem-solving skills
* Adept critical thinking skills for complex issues

Resodyn Corporation is a fast-paced, technology development company located in Southwest Montana. An excellent career and lifestyle opportunity for the correct individual exists to work on state-of-the-art research and development of various emerging technologies having both near-term and future commercial potential. Resodyn Corporation, a successful, developer, designer and manufacturer of advanced technology equipment has enjoyed solid growth in recent years as a result of their cutting-edge technology and distributes their products globally.

Visit our web site at http://www.resodynmixers.com

description:
Lead and facilitate the implementation of Lean methodologies across various departments.

improvement.

 Design and implement optimized processes to improve overall efficiency and reduce cycle times.

 Drive a culture of continuous improvement by fostering a mindset of innovation and problem-solving.

initiatives.

title: System Safety Engineer
description:
**About Us:**
Merlin is an early-stage autonomy company, building software to control sophisticated transportation systems. Our mission here at Merlin Labs is to develop hardware and software solutions that deliver the capability for aircraft to fly useful missions autonomously and safely. Our first product will be a certified system to bring automation to existing fixed wing aircraft.  

We’re backed by some of the top institutional venture capitalists in the country, our headquarters are located in Boston with hubs in Denver, Los Angeles and the Mojave Desert. Come join our diverse, world class team, made up of people from places like Google, Airbus, Boeing, UTC, the US Navy, and the US Air Force.  

Do you want to work on the forefront of aviation with a company that puts safety and certification first? Are you an experienced system safety engineer looking for something that you can’t find in big aerospace? Do you want to work in a startup that has a certification-based approach? Do you dream about having a big impact on the future of safe aviation systems? If so, you might be a good fit for the System Safety Engineer role here at Merlin.
### **Responsibilities**

* The System Safety Engineer is responsible for developing and coordinating multiple activities of the system safety process for multiple Merlin products.
* Employs safety analysis techniques (in alignment with SAE ARP4761 and MIL-STD-882) on the engineering products.
* Works with peers to analyze safety-critical systems, hardware, and software to support compliance demonstration
* Flows down safety requirements to the development teams and peers, and ensures they are appropriately captured and implemented in the design.
* Prepares and delivers analyses, and participates in safety review meetings, system design meetings, and change board meetings.
* Works in a team environment by providing inputs to engineers, performing analyses, and writing reports.

### **Requirements**

* Bachelor's Degree in a Technical field preferred, or equivalent Systems Safety experience
* 3 years of experience utilizing system safety techniques for safety critical systems, such as avionics/autoflight systems.
* Engineering and/or product development as an engineer, or significant field experience is required
* Previous experience working with MIL-STD-882 with working knowledge of SAE ARP4761
* Strong interpersonal and technical writing skills
* Ability to work in a self-directed manner

### **Nice to Have:**

* FAA DER or member of an ODA-UM with a Safety Analysis delegated function is a significant advantage.
* Experience with developing and coordinating safety artifacts including, FHAs (Functional Hazard Assessment), SSAs (System Safety Assessment), Fault Trees, and other analyses
* Previous experience working with SAE ARP 4754A, RTCA/DO-178B/C, RTCA/DO-254, MIL-STD-882
* Previous experience performing safety assessment activities for high-criticality aerospace systems that utilized software and airborne electronic hardware (including CEH devices), such as powered Flight Controls, Flight Management System, and Display Systems.
* Experience on part 23 and part 25 aircraft
* Practical experience in electrical, mechanical, or aerospace engineering preferred
* Experience working with automatic flight controls is a plus
* Knowledge of human factors is a plus
* Pilot certification is a plus


Merlin Labs offers an innovative, entrepreneurial, and team-focused startup environment. We also offer a top-notch benefits package (health, dental, life, unlimited vacation, and 401k with match) and work/life integration. Being part of the Merlin team allows you to become part of a small team that supports professional development while working together to achieve our mission.  

Merlin Labs is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. All job offers are contingent upon the candidate passing background, export control and reference checks.  

Merlin Labs does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from candidates.

title: Senior Process Engineer
description:
Position Type: **Permanent Full Time**

Job Title: **Senior Process Engineer, RNG Industry**

What makes BerQ RNG great? Our People! Each employee contributes to creating a clean and safe environment, improving the lives of people around the world. Come join us on this exciting journey as we work towards a more sustainable future!

**About Us**  
BerQ RNG builds and develops renewable natural gas projects in addition to buying and selling renewable natural gas. BerQ RNG is structured to contribute positively to the environment by using biogas that is currently flared into the atmosphere. Throughout North America, thousands of locations are flaring biogas because it is not pure enough or economical enough to use. We consider this a waste of resources and aim to eliminate this practice in North America. We have developed a business model that can use these resources economically and, as such, can earn money for our investors while cleaning up the environment. For more information on BerQ RNG, please visit our website at *www.berqrng.com*.

**About the Job**  
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Process/Operations Engineer with 5-10 years experience to join our growing RNG (Renewable Natural Gas) company. In this role, you will play a critical part in helping to optimize existing operations by collecting and analyzing information and acting on it to drive tangible improvements to RNG production and reducing costs.

We are looking for a dynamic team member with a positive attitude, excellent interpersonal skills and strong analytical skills using Aveva PI and AI. You should be proficient at working on multiple projects simultaneously and be equally comfortable working independently and in a team setting.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Monitoring and assessing operational systems, analyzing data, identifying trends, and proposing corrective actions to maintain optimal process performance, reduce downtime, and enhance overall productivity.
* Monitoring and assessing facility processes on an ongoing basis to ensure they are operating in accordance with safety, environmental, quality, output, and efficiency targets.
* Identifying opportunities for process improvement, proposing innovative solutions, and leading or contributing to process optimization projects to drive efficiency, cost savings, and environmental sustainability.
* Collaborating with operators, maintenance personnel, and other stakeholders to troubleshoot issues, optimize process performance, and ensure safe and efficient operations.
* Helping to investigate and troubleshoot process problems, identifying root cause failures and developing remedial solutions.
* Investigating and deploying new technology to improve facility production and reliability.
* Working with consultants and contractors to obtain proposals, establish work plans/schedules and safe work requirements.
* Project management for implementation of process upgrades and major maintenance (e.g. procure and install a new H2S removal system or manage a digester cleanout).
* Writing/editing operational summaries and providing technical summaries of data analyses.
* Develop and implement plant-level specific systems such as SOPs, or updates to existing plant documentation.
* Participate in Corporate Health and Safety meetings and training as required.
* Perform other related administrative or project-based duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field. Professional Engineering Designation is preferred.
* 5-10 years of work experience as an Operations/Process Engineer or in a similar role, preferably in the renewable natural gas industry.
* Must have experience in anaerobic digestion and the biogas (digester, landfill) industry.
* Experience with process optimization, process control, and AI/machine learning data analysis.
* Experience with Aveva PI would be an asset.
* Experience with SCADA systems, ladder logic, Factory Talk and Ignition is an asset.
* Experience in working with P&IDs, PFDs, General Arrangement, Shop drawings, Instrumentation and Electrical drawings.
* Field experience is an industrial setting, preferably Energy or Wastewater treatment asset.
* Analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to analyze technical challenges, propose innovative solutions, and make informed decisions. Strong troubleshooting abilities to address project-related issues and mitigate risks effectively.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, contractors, and stakeholders. Proven ability to present technical information in a clear and concise manner.
* Familiarity with codes and standards particularly as they apply to the natural gas industry.
* Proficient use of Microsoft Office and ability to use CAD and other engineering tools.
* Health and safety oriented.
* Excellent organization and time management skills, including the ability to balance multiple priorities and stay focused on priorities in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines.
* Must be a strong team player who is able to collaborate with colleagues on complex assignments.
* Flexibility to do what needs to be done with a roll-up-the-sleeves attitude.
* Ability to travel within the US and Canada as needed.
* Valid driver’s license.

**Job Location**

Open to remote working in addition to offices in Oakville, Ontario Canada, and Pittsburgh, PA US. Ability to travel to visit project sites, suppliers, meetings, and conferences up to 25% of time.

Compensation:

**In addition to a collaborative and supportive work environment Berq RNG offers:**

* Competitive salary.
* Annual performance incentive bonus opportunity.
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental health coverage for you and your family.
* 401k Retirement Plan with company match.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* A culture that values teamwork, collaboration, and opportunity for growth and development.

BerQ RNG is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to promoting a work environment that embraces diversity, equity, inclusion, and respect. BerQ RNG provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, age, sex, national origin, veteran status, or other legally protected classification in accordance with applicable Federal, state, and local laws.

**Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the US or Canada with no restrictions.**

**How to Apply:**

Please send you resume and cover letter with the subject heading “ Senior Operations Engineer” to **hr@bergrng.com.**

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Sales Engineer – Industrial Control/Operational Technology
description:
**Job Title: Sales Engineer – Industrial Control/Operational Technology**  

**Department: Sales**  

**Reports to: Sales Manager**  

  

Owl Cyber Defense is a leader and trusted partner in cyber security. We deliver solutions that protect and connect the world’s most critical networks. Owl’s product lines of cross domain, data diode, and portable media solutions provide unexploitable security checkpoints for absolute threat prevention and secure data availability. Our in-depth expertise in security engineering at the operating system level enables us to help government and commercial customers meet ever-evolving cyber security threats.  

  

**Job Summary:**  

Owl has an immediate need for a Sales Engineer to join our Sales team. The Sales Engineer being a subject matter expert in Industrial Controls and Operational Technology, will maintain a professional rapport with customers and endeavor to give them the best possible service while bridging the gap between the company's business development team, and software engineers, to provide enhanced service and response.  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users
* Primary technical resource for the Sales Team
* Actively drive and manage technology of the evaluation stage of sales process
* Work as a key technical advisor to advocate our products
* Comprehensive understanding of customer’s security system architecture
* Able to identify all technical issues to assure the Sales team is proposing the best solution for our customers
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with the customer’s technical personnel throughout the sales cycle
* Support the initial installation of products and services
* Manage continuous customer relationships to obtain product improvement ideas and share information with the R&D team

**Qualifications:**
* B.S. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field is strongly preferred
* Must have had previous hands-on experience with programming and/or scripting in a technical role (5+ years)
* Must be able to obtain/maintain a US Government security clearance
* Must be available for 20-40% travel, for pre-sales meeting
	+ Domestic and International travel is expected.

**Job Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:**
* Experience and familiarity with products similar to the company’s lines of business is desired
* 4 to 6 years relevant experience in supporting high technology engineering
* Candidate should have experience and full understanding of IC applications utilizing OPC DA, OPC UA, Modbus, Aveva PI System, Historian replication, MQTT, AMQP, FT, SFTP/FTP, Syslog, SNMP, SMTP, time synchronization, SQL/MSQL and other industrial protocols
* Responsible for development and delivery of product demonstrations
* Responsible for representing the product or solution to customers and at field events such as trade shows, conferences, seminars, etc.
* Must have strong analytical, presentation and organizational skills
* Able to respond to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs
* Able to quickly obtain the relevant information to understand and explain the customer’s security system architecture
* Able to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches
* Able to convey customer requirements to Sales team
* Able to convey customer requirements to the company's engineering and research and development departments to devise new ways of meeting customer requirements for use of the company’s products
* Able to listen to potential clients' needs and to explain how the company’s product can satisfy those needs
* Able to demonstrate in extensive, technical detail how the company’s products are different than that of the competition
* Following a sale, the Sales Engineer provides any technical support the customer may need for installing and operating the products or solutions
* Able to provide training for the customer employees who will use the product or solution
* Able to take the initiative to maintain contact with the customer to ensure that the customer’s needs have been met and to assist them with any additional problems that may arise well after the purchase
* Sales engineer is in constant contact with customers with the objective to obtain a good idea of the improvements customers would like to see in the company’s products and bring this information to the research and development team
* Sales Engineer works to bring the company products and solutions in line with customer expectations
* Must be self-motivated with a proven track record in supporting high technology hardware and software sales.
* Must be comfortable in a small, high growth company requiring independent initiative and careful thought to customer’s needs.
* Demonstrate a high level of commitment to staying current with relevant changes in technology


  

**About Owl** **Cyber Defense Solutions, LLC**  

Owl Cyber Defense Solutions, LLC is a fast-growing cybersecurity solutions company, holding a firm leadership position in network security and secure information transfer. It is a privately-owned US company with offices in Columbia, MD, Danbury, CT and Morrisville, NC. For more information, see http://www.owlcyberdefense.com.  

Owl Cyber Defense is Proud to be an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer
description:
**Description**


Leidos is seeking an experienced Controls Engineer for work at its Walled Lake, Michigan office. We are seeking qualified individuals with experience to excel in a high performance team responsible for the development and delivery of market leading controls services and solutions.


As a Automation Engineer, you will provide technical expertise and work as a part of a team with other engineers and consultants involved in the design and implementation of diverse and challenging solutions for industrial and commercial clients. The ideal candidate would be responsible for the entire lifecycle of a project. Your responsibilities will range from performing system requirements analysis, hardware design, PLC programming, integration, verification and commissioning of controls systems. The successful candidate will have controls experience, knowledge of industry standards and current technologies, outstanding communication skills and the ability to meet project requirements.


Core Duties and Responsibilities:

* Produce best in class, robust solutions for electrical / software applications in automation, material handling, robotics, logistics & general manufacturing.
* Working with our Business Development team to professionally represent the company, gather data, and ask the right questions to define a project.
* Attend client sites to discuss solutions and complete site surveys.
* Identify & interpret customer requirements to understand their processes and develop the best solutions for their requirements.
* Conduct technology research / analysis.
* Support risk identification and mitigation.
* Communicate with the customer and assess their want to produce an RFQ when there isn’t one available.
* Produce technical proposals to the required level of detail as identified in the client tender/RFQ.
* Develop value-added propositions and proposal writing.
* Support estimating & supply chain activities with RFQ production.
* Manage resources in the production of the proposal e.g., internal engineering and third-party engineering resources.
* Assist and advise other members of the Applications team on solutions, stakeholder reviews, customer and supplier interaction.
* Support development of the Applications department’s processes and discuss improvements where required, and implement improvements agreed with the leadership team.
* Excellent understanding of industrial safety and its application when developing solutions.
* Development and maintenance of Bills of Materials.
* Develop “first pass” estimates to be reviewed and assessed by the relevant teams for accuracy.
* Work as part of the Applications team & adapt as required to ensure workload is prioritized.
* Respond to customer enquiries & requests promptly, professionally and effectively. This may require working to tight deadlines to meet customer driven timelines.
* Manage and prioritize workload as required applying a measured approach according to urgency/importance.
* Effectively present technical documentation and solutions to all other departments in line with requirements, & handle questions & feedback constructively & professionally.
* Support the sales processes technically in presentations, meetings and other interactions with the customer.
* Support the BD team technically during site visits, at exhibitions, open days and other events.
* Achieve buy-in to proposed solution of all stakeholders both internal and external.
* Assess and assimilate stakeholder feedback where appropriate.
* Contribute to the overall business as required whether, or not the task is directly related to job role e.g., support design engineering if demand requires.
* Follow Group and Company policies and procedures at all times.
* Use all Company equipment and personal PPE properly and in accordance with Company procedures.
* Report all health and safety issues and concerns to your line manager and/or a Health and Safety Representative in a timely and professional manner.
* Familiarize oneself with, and adhere to, the Company’s Equality Policy at all times.
* All employees must conduct themselves in accordance with our Corporate Company Values and Business Ethics at all times.
* If home working flexibility will be required to attend Leidos sites within the UK or globally as required.
* Visiting clients in the US and abroad as required during none- production hours and weekends as necessary.
* Work overtime as necessary to achieve project goals/deadlines


Skills and Required Experience;

* Highly Organized & self-motivated.
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Excellent knowledge of MS Excel
* Sound understanding of MS Office packages.
* Proficient in either SolidWorks / AutoCAD / Inventor
* Team player.
* Good technical literacy skills.
* Adaptable & flexible.
* Proven experience in Electrical / Software Engineering solutions for Mechanical / Mechanical Handling systems.
* Knowledge of Manufacturing Automation methods and processes.
* Supplier base knowledge.
* Understanding of project costs - design, management, manufacture, installation etc.
* Knowledge of major automotive OEM standards – Ford GVOSS / Tesla / JLR / Stellantis
* Knowledge of current industry Materials Handling systems best practice for automotive & general industry.
* Knowledge of current Industry Automation controls best practice and techniques experience for automotive and general industry.


Required Education:


Degree in Electrical / Software Engineering or equivalent experience.

**Original Posting Date:**
--------------------------


2024-02-01
While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

**Pay Range:**
--------------


Pay Range $65,000.00 - $117,500.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

CommonSpirit Health was formed by the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives (CHI) and Dignity Health.
